text.p: NARODNA OBRODA - Foreign Minister Pavol Hamzik reaffirmed that Slovakia's main goal was integration in NATO in the first wave of accepted countries. He expects the first group accepted to NATO would consist of five to six countries, including Slovakia.
- The new securities law passed by parliament on Tuesday will contribute to the transparency of the stock market.
HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - The proposal to set up an ExIm bank could lead to undermining the role of the central bank and increase state interference in the economy.
- The ruling parliamentary coalition committed an act of total disrespect towards the head of state by walking out of President Michal Kovac's state of the nation address to parliament on Wednesday.
- Prime Minister Vladimir Meciar met U.S. ambassador Ralph Johnson behind closed doors on Wednesday at Johnson's request. Both sides agreed to divulge no information on the meeting.

PRAVDA - Acccording to Privatisation Minister Peter Bisak all privatisation decisions are legally based and thus valid. According to the law once an enterprise has been privatised the decision cannot be revoked.
- Any speculation on imminent government changes is unfounded and false, the government spokeswoman said.

SME - Finance Minister Sergej Kozlik has rejected a request by Bratislava mayor Peter Kresanek to lower energy prices of the city's social institutions, which are currently charged prices for private entrepreneurs.
- The Slovak Council for Radio and Television has refused the request of private Radio Twist for a licence for a broadcast frequency for Kosice.

SLOVENSKA REPUBLIKA - Wednesdsay's address to parliament by President Michal Kovac on the state of the nation fully revealed the falseness of his proclamations for the need for national reconciliation.
